info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 1:06PM PST until February 23 at 7:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations will be generally under 4 inches below 6,000 feet. Areas above 6,000 feet will receive 4 to 8 inches with localized amounts up to 12 inches. * WHERE...The San Bernardino, Riverside, and San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Snowy and windy conditions will make for difficult travel with whiteout conditions at times. Along with mountain highways, Interstate 15 through the Cajon Pass and Interstate 8 through the San Diego County Mountains will experience these conditions with light snowfall expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow will occur Tuesday night into Wednesday morning across the region. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
